intro: Scleria scrobiculata subsp. scrobiculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences that bear small, three-lobed flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
